formattedAddress: Empire State Trl RIverside, Park South, W 70th St #500, New York, NY 10069, USA
adrFormatAddress: Empire State Trl RIverside, Park South, W 70th St #500, New York, NY 10069, USA

editorialSummary.text: Casual American dining with scenic views, open May to mid-October in Riverside Park South.

originalText.text:
Pier i Cafe is both a phenomenal spot to eat on the Upper West Side AND something fun to do!

It's open from May to mid-October. But when open, it serves as an amazing spot to grab some delicious food and take in beautiful NYC days with a view of the water.

They offer local beers, fresh salads, really tasty fish and chips, and so much more.

The cafe is right near a pier and offers plenty of outdoor seating. We love coming here with our dogs!

originalText.text: Very basic chicken strips that don’t come with fries for $14, No refills on sodas, pretty tasty non alcoholic mango frozen drinks, and pretty good views right on the Hudson River. This place could be much more than it is and should be for the location it’s at and the price that things cost. Could be a great place to stop for drinks, but I would skip the food.

text.text: Very basic chicken strips that don’t come with fries for $14, No refills on sodas, pretty tasty non alcoholic mango frozen drinks, and pretty good views right on the Hudson River. originalText.text: Great spot for a drink and light food on the WSH. There are a ton of tables available with umbrellas and with great views. Food was much better than I was expecting! Also drinks are very good and big compared to the usual size of cocktails for the same price. Will definitely be coming back here for more summer sunsets.

text.text: Great spot for a drink and light food on the WSH. There are a ton of tables available with umbrellas and with great views. Food was much better than I was expecting! Also drinks are very good and big compared to the usual size of cocktails for the same price. Will definitely be coming back here for more summer sunsets.

originalText.text: Stopped here a get a beer & some food, while on the bike path. Great location , plenty of seating right on the water. Order your food & they give you a pager when it’s ready. The line to order went quick & the food took about 5-10 minutes to come out.  You can also order online using the QR Code ahead of time. Had a Hamburger & it was really good. Definitely worth stopping at. Will be back to order more items on the menu.

text.text: Stopped here a get a beer & some food, while on the bike path. Great location , plenty of seating right on the water. Order your food & they give you a pager when it’s ready. The line to order went quick & the food took about 5-10 minutes to come out.  You can also order online using the QR Code ahead of time. Had a Hamburger & it was really good. Definitely worth stopping at. Will be back to order more items on the menu.

originalText.text: Cute place with tables with umbrellas.  The best part is the view.  From here you look unto the Hudson River.  It is located alongside Riverside Park.  I can't rate the food because I didn't have any.  The beers are reasonably priced.  The Cocktails are not that pricey considering the venue.  The atmosphere is relaxed and it's dog friendly.  I didn't give too many stars for service because it isn't table service.  You can go up to the counter and order or you can scan a code at the table, order online and they call your name for pickup.  The lady at the counter was very nice.  At 7p.m. they were going to have music by the water.  I might go back or I might not but I'm glad I went at least once.
